channel.title: Portfolio
channel.description: I write about exciting technologies, development and best practices at large.

item.title: AWS image recognition pipeline using S3, SQS, and Rekognition.
item.description: An image recognition pipeline in AWS, using two parallel EC2 instances, S3 for cloud storage, SQS to communicate between VMs, and Rekognition for the machine learning algorithm to detect objects and texts.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: I built a Pokedex to demonstrate Next.js' data fetching techniques.
item.description: Pokedex built using Next.js to demonstrate client-side rendering (CSR), server-side rendering (SSR), and static-site generation (SSG).
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Upload image to AWS S3 (using Localstack).
item.description: We take a look at how to upload image files to AWS S3 using Localstack development environment. Built using Nest.js + Typescript.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Typescript - Supercharged features of a typed-system
item.description: We discuss the underlying benefits of a typed-system out of the box and how it can help write maintainable, scalable, and less error prone code.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Nest.js - Architectural Pattern, Controllers, Providers, and Modules.
item.description: We take a look at NestJS, a framework for building efficient, scalable Node.js server-side applications. We will try to understand the overall architectural pattern of NestJS.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: How Netflix - a popular media streaming service onboards and delivers its content to millions of users.
item.description: We try to design a system much like Netflix that would scale to millions of users worldwide and talk through possible architectures and microservices that can help deliver an online streaming service.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Zustand - A simple, fast, and convenient state-management solution using Hooks API.
item.description: Zustand is a small, fast and scaleable state-management solution for your application.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Core Web Vitals can remediate your website's bad user experience.
item.description: Core Web Vitals uses metrices like Largest Contentful Paint, First Input Delay and Cumulative Layout Shift to determine the overall user-experience of your website.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Module Federation in Next.js (Available as a Webpack plugin)
item.description: Module federation allows sharing of isolated builds between applications at runtime. It is also available as a webpack v5 plugin.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Styled Components in React.
item.description: Enhance dynamic styling in your React components using Javascriptâ€™s ES6 syntax. Automatic critical CSS, no class name bugs, and easier deletion of CSS.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Absolute imports and module path aliases are a game changer!
item.description: Absolute imports and module path alias helps us avoid writing the exact import path of a deeply-rooted component.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Data Fetching (useStaticProps) in Next.js using Headless CMS Strapi.
item.description: A simple Next.js application that demonstrates fetching data hosted on a Headless CMS called Strapi through an API.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Redux/Context API for state management in React.
item.description: Is Context API better than Redux for state management? Know how they help avoid the concept of prop drilling!
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Stable Incremental Static Re-generation (Next.js 9.5+).
item.description: Next.js has introduced a very handy feature called Incremental Static Re-generation from versions 9.5 and above. Know what the fuss is about!
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: SWR - React Hooks library for remote data fetching.
item.description: SWR or stale-while-revalidate helps developers to immediately load cached data and ensure freshness of the data by updating the cached content later.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Accessibility and SEO optimizations in Next.js application (Lighthouse).
item.description: An application demonstrating simple tweaks to boost SEO and Accessibility the right way!
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Next.js (useStaticProps, useStaticPaths) + Static JSON Data.
item.description: There are multiple different ways (useStaticProps, useStaticPaths, useServerSideProps) to fetch data in Next.js. Let's build an application using the different methods.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Built-in automatic image optimization in Next.js.
item.description: Next.js has introduced Automatic Image Optimization in versions 10.0.0 and above, using a built-in Image Component.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: Two factor authentication (2FA) using Speakeasy, Node and Express.
item.description: Know how to configure a two factor authentication for your application using Speakeasy!
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: JAMStack - Future of development?
item.description: JAMstack is a fairly new modern development architecture based on JavaScript, APIs, and Markup.
item.author: sboro2899@gmail.com (Sintu Boro)

item.title: history.push not re-rendering component.
item.description: React-router got me agitated indefinitiely. Problem with history and react-router versioning.

item.title: Write a custom reusable Hook (useFetch).
item.description: Demonstrating how to build a custom reusable Hook 'useFetch' for React application.
